definition: Caltrop or puncture vine (Tribulus terrestris)/to thatch (a roof)

sentences.english: Gates sat through it silently for about an hour.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨坐了约一个小时，自始至终沉默不言。

sentences.english: You can't buy the time and save it in your storeroom even if you are Mr. Gates.
sentences.chinese: 你不能买下时间存在储藏室里，就算你是盖茨也不行。

sentences.english: Except whenbeing interviewed at D with Bill Gates.
sentences.chinese: 除了和盖茨同台被采访的时候。

sentences.english: Gates said that the effectiveness of aid is not well-publicised.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨说援助的有效性没有被充分宣传。

sentences.english: Gatsby and I in turn leaned down and took the small reluctant hand.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨比和我先后弯下腰来，握一握不情愿的小手。

sentences.english: Gates' performance during the hearing didn't sway the powers that be.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨当时在听证会上的表现没能改变当政者的看法。

sentences.english: In the three most recent yearbooks, I found several photos of Gates.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的三期里，我发现了几张盖茨的照片。

sentences.english: Gates found their recalcitrance equally frustrating.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨发现他们顽固不化同样感到沮丧。

sentences.english: Gates yelled to a crowd outside his house as he was handcuffed.
sentences.chinese: 当他被戴上手铐时，盖茨向房子周围的人群大喊。

sentences.english: The Gates Foundation hopes that further research will see such reforms replicated elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨基金会希望，这种教改可普遍到其他各地。

sentences.english: The United States did not pre-announced visit by Bill Gates.
sentences.chinese: 美国方面并没有提前宣布盖茨的此次访问。

sentences.english: He suggested he could start sifting through the requests for money and give some out.
sentences.chinese: 他建议盖茨可以开始筛选募捐请求，并捐出一部分钱。

sentences.english: As a computer fan, Sandy worshiped the worldwide famous Bill Gates very much.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个电脑迷，桑迪非常崇拜全球闻名的比尔盖茨。

sentences.english: His mother was doting and easygoing.
sentences.chinese: 老盖茨的母亲对孩子比较溺爱，为人非常随和。

sentences.english: Bill Gates and Michael Jordan are citizens of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 盖茨和乔丹都是美国公民。

definition: Mark Zuckerberg (1984-), American computer programer, co-founder and CEO of Facebook
Warren Buffett (1930-), the Sage of Omaha, US investor and philanthropist, principal owner of holding company Berkshire Hathaway
Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Carnegie (name)/Andrew Carnegie (1835-1919), Scots American steel millionaire and philanthropist
Steve Jobs (1955-2011), US co-founder and CEO of Apple, Inc.
pinyin: Shi3 di4 fu1 · Qiao2 bu4 si1
